email_subject: We need you to take immediate action!
email_content: It looks like your someone has attempted to access your bank account using your password.\nPlease reset your password following the link below:\n[https://b775sgH5j4.co/hHjz6Gu]
reason: The email asks for personal information regarding your bank account - whereas most banks will never ask you to reveal personal information immediately. If you take a look at the URL, you can also notice this is not a legitimate domain for any bank.

email_content:
$2,000 PAK'nSAVE reward!
Congratulations, you are a winner!
You qualify for a $2,000 PACK'nSAVE reward , this email is Our Official News Letter for your persual.
Remember, you are one of the only few selected. Registration is only possible for the next 24 hours!
[GET YOUR $2,000 PAK'nSAVE REWARD NOW! reward.pdf]
reason: The sender's email irrelevant to topic on email content and time urgency can be a sign of a possible phishing attack. Also, notice the PDF link, it is best only to open these if the email is from a certain and trusted sender.

email_content:
Hi,
Someone just used your password to sign into your Google Account.
Information:
[insert py dateTime.now]
[first_name][last_name]
Firefox browser
Google stopped this sign-in attempt. You should change your password immediately.
["Change password" button links to "https://support.google.com-scan78.co.ac/passswipe/245556gysuu7"]
reason: The email google.support isn't actually used by Google. The link in the button actually sends the user to a website discuised as a google domain, but really we can see that the domain is com-scan78.co.ac.

email_subject: The latest on your bank scheme
email_content:
Hi [first_name],
It's been another eventful year amid the COVID-19 pandemic and the recent Delta strain outbreak and swift move into lockdown may leave some investors feeling uncertain. Since the first outbreak in New Zealand last March, investments and sharemarkets have recovered strongly, so in times like this, it's important to stick to your long-term investment goals, rather than focusing on the day-to-day movements.
To keep up to date with what's happening in financial markets, and the latest news and insights from our team of experts, check out our investor hub. We'll update this page regularly as things develop.
[Read More https://www.asb.co.nz/]
reason: Sender is using a relevant email for ASB ansd the link is a legitimate domain for ASB: asb.co.nz/

email_subject: Hurry! 20% for the next two days only
email_content:
We are having our annual anniversary sale at ShopCheap!
Get in quick before the sale ends, all items are 20% off for only 24 hours.
[Shop now! https://www.shopcheap.com/browse/sale]
ShopCheap [Terms and conditions: https://www.shopcheap.com/uhp/userAgreement]
reason: Even though there is urgency in the message, the requests are not for information and the email is purely promotional.

email_content:
Sophie Watson shared the following document with you
[2022 sales report: https://docs.google.com/document/2022SalesReport/1096Ghy5F/edit]
Comment: Hey [first_name], heres the doc you requested. Sorry late. - Soph
[Open in Docs]
reason: The message has been from the sender and even though some grammer may be incorrect or casual, we can tell that sender Sophie was in a rush to share a document with you "sorry late".
The link it is trying to hide an image as a  Google Doc image, when really the domain pointed to by the link is malre.com.

email_content:
Hi [first_name],
[ShopCheap document link: https://www.shopCheap.com] wants to view your email settings.
Allow ShopCheap to do this? ["Terms and conditions" document link: https://www.shopcheap.com/uhp/userAgreement]
    [Don't allow][Allow]
reason: You always need to proceed with caution when dealing with emails that request any kind of permissions. The email also includes the kind of access they are requesting, it is important to read this carefully before pressing Allow.
